posts.title: California Bike Manufacturer Signs Lease With Ledger
posts.content:
A high-end bike manufacturer has signed a lease with Ledger in Bentonville to occupy approximately 4,200 square feet on the first floor of the six-story building downtown.

  • Local presence: Specialized Bicycle Components has centers in Colorado and California, and the Bentonville location will open in the fall with Ledger, soon-to-be the world’s first bikeable building. 
  • First floor: The new Specialized space has been designed to be an “Experience Center” and a “communal hub” before and after time on the trails with areas to take a post-ride shower and enjoy a coffee. Specialized is the second business after Mertins Eye & Optical to announce a lease agreement with Ledger. 

Read the Talk Business & Politics story HERE.

posts.title: Terrific Tuesday Night Series Begins at the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks
posts.content:
This evening, the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks is kicking off its summer Terrific Tuesday night series! The botanical garden has activities and events in store through August, every Tuesday from 5-8p, all free to the public. 

  • Opera in the garden: For the first Tuesday of the summer series, Opera in the Ozarks will be performing Pinocchio in the garden. Gates open at 5p, and the show will begin at 6p. 
  • Eat and relax: Simple + Sweet Creamery will be at the event selling ice cream, and outside food for picnics is welcome as well. So bring your lawn chairs and blankets and enjoy the events over the next couple of months!

For more information, click HERE.

posts.title: Dance Studio In Rogers To Host Grand Opening Celebration
posts.topic: Sponsored by Arthur Murray Dance Studio
posts.content:
There’s a new dance studio in Rogers and the owners invite you to the grand opening celebration! 

  • Dance party: Arthur Murray Dance Studio is designed to resemble a 1920s ballroom lounge complete with a baby grand piano. The celebration on June 11 will have food, music, and promises lots of fun on the dance floor — even if you have two left feet and no rhythm. 
  • Learn to dance: If you sign up for the Grand Opening Special before June 11, you will receive one free Personal Dance Lesson; no dance partner or experience is required. Start your dance journey connected and join the DanceNWA Facebook Group too! 

Click HERE to learn more about the grand opening.

posts.title: Report Shows NWA Recycled 41,000+ Tons Of Material Last Year
posts.content:
According to the latest recycling report from the Northwest Arkansas Council, NWA recycled more than 41,000 tons of material in 2021. 

  • Collections: The NWA Recycles report was the first to tally collections from the Benton County and Boston Mountain solid waste districts and a dozen other cities with public recycling programs. The recycling collections included typical materials like aluminum cans and cardboard as well as more unusual items like tires, electronics, and yard waste. 
  • Materials: Among the report’s findings, in 2021, the region recycled 300 tons of electronic waste, 1,000 tons of aluminum, steel, and other scrap metal; 1,000 tons of glass bottles and jars, 9,000 tons of yard and food waste for composting, and 14,000 tons of cardboard and paper. 

See the full report HERE.

posts.title: Berry Fest Around the Corner
posts.content:
Bentonville's third annual Berry Fest is around the corner and tickets are on sale now.

  • Pick for a cause: Berry Fest is June 17-18 at the Help One Now berry farm. All proceeds from the festival will help support the non-profit's community care efforts and mission to equip children internationally "transition into adulthood successfully." 
  • Festivities: In addition to berry picking, there will be live music from local artists and several food trucks available . The event will go from 4-7p both days. Tickets are $25 for adults, $10 for youth under 18, and free for children under 5. 

For tickets and more information, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Birthday party: First National Bank is hosting a concert on Thursday, complete with food, beer, and cornhole for its 150th birthday, and you're invited!*
  • Science: Researchers at the U of A recently deepened scientists' understanding of animal vision. 
  • On the road: The number of registered electric vehicles in Arkansas was up 43% through May of 2022.
  • Shakes: Did you feel it? As of 10a yesterday, there had been 6 small quakes in Northwest Arkansas. 
  • Super: Arkansas baseball is headed to the Super Regionals after a thrilling win last night over Oklahoma State.
  • Collab: Let's get your story out by putting you in the newsletter. Check out our advertising deals here.

*Content is sponsored
